Package DAO

Class DBCustomer

java.lang.Object
DAO.DBCustomer
public class DBCustomer extends Object
Holds the database interaction methods for the Customer class (Contains lambda).

    • addCustomer

      public static void addCustomer(String name, String address, Division division, String post, String phone)
      Inserts a new customer row entry into the customers database table.
      Parameters:
      name - name to INSERT.
      address - address to INSERT.
      division - divison to INSERT.
      post - postal code to INSERT.
      phone - phone number to INSERT.

    • modCustomer

      public static void modCustomer(String name, String address, Division division, String post, String phone, int cid)
      UPDATEs selected customer in the customers database table based on user selection and a customer ID match.
      Parameters:
      name - name to UPDATE.
      address - address to UPDATE.
      division - division to UPDATE.
      post - postal code to UPDATE.
      phone - phone number to UPDATE.
      cid - customer ID to match.

    • delCustomer

      public static void delCustomer(Customer c)
      DELETEs a customer from the customers database table (Uses lambda for fewer LoC).
      Checks if the customer has any appointments and alerts the user if they do. User is informed that appointments must be deleted before customer can be deleted. A confirmation box asks the user if they are sure they want to delete the customer. If the user selects OK, the customer is deleted and the user is notified. Confirmation box saves on lines of code and class imports with a lambda expression. If a customer is deleted, the user is returned to the main view.
      Parameters:
      c - the customer to delete.

    • customerCheck

      public static boolean customerCheck(int id) throws SQLException
      Checks if customer ID input is in the customers database table and alerts the user if not found.
      Parameters:
      id - customer ID to check for.
      Returns:
      if the id is found.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a SQL statement error is thrown.
